This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, with the wholesome roots that arise from repenting and removing all the grave obstacles of karma;

The Buddhas of the three times attain perfect enlightenment, turn the wheel of the true Dharma, and tame sentient beings. Bodhisattvas know all this and give rise to a mind of sympathetic joy, the wholesome roots that arise from this;

The Buddhas of the three times, from their initial resolve, cultivating bodhisattva practices, attaining perfect enlightenment, up to manifesting entry into parinirvÄá¹‡a, after parinirvÄá¹‡a, the true Dharma abiding in the world until its extinction, to all of this they give rise to sympathetic joy, the wholesome roots that are possessed.

The bodhisattva thus contemplates the inconceivable buddha-realms and his own realm, up to the unobstructed realm of enlightenment. In this way, all the wholesome roots that are accumulated, all that is believed and understood, all that is rejoiced in, all that is perfected, all that is accomplished, all that is practiced, all that is attained, all that is known and awakened to, all that is upheld, and all that is increased, are all dedicated to adorning all buddha-lands - just as in the boundless eons of the past, in all worlds, in the places where all tathÄgatas have practiced.

All the Buddha-lands within them.

Adorned Buddha-lands, pure Buddha-lands, equal Buddha-lands, wondrous Buddha-lands, powerful Buddha-lands, vast Buddha-lands, blissful Buddha-lands, indestructible Buddha-lands, inexhaustible Buddha-lands, immeasurable Buddha-lands, unshakable Buddha-lands, fearless Buddha-lands, luminous Buddha-lands, irreproachable Buddha-lands, delightful Buddha-lands, universally illuminating Buddha-lands, well-adorned Buddha-lands, splendid Buddha-lands, wondrous Buddha-lands, supreme Buddha-lands, excellent Buddha-lands, distinguished Buddha-lands, unsurpassed Buddha-lands, unequaled Buddha-lands, incomparable Buddha-lands, and inexpressible Buddha-lands.

In this way, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, with his own wholesome roots, gives rise to the mind of aspiration and dedicates it to all the adornments of the Buddha-lands in the past, future, and present:

'May I adorn this world with the pure adornments of all Buddhas of the past, present, and future. May all the adornments of the Buddha-lands of all Buddhas be fully accomplished, fully purified, fully gathered, fully manifested, fully splendid, and fully upheld.
As with one world;
in this way, throughout the entire Dharma realm and space, in all worlds, may the various adornments of the Buddha-lands of all Buddhas of the three times be fully complete.'
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas further dedicate their roots of goodness in this way:
'May I cultivate all Buddha-lands and fill them with great bodhisattvas.

Those bodhisattvas had true natures, wisdom and understanding, and were well able to discern all worlds and the realms of sentient beings. They had deeply penetrated the Dharma realm and the realm of space, and had abandoned ignorance.

They had accomplished the recollection of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the inconceivable truth, and the recollection of the Sangha as being immeasurable and all-pervading. They also had the recollection of renunciation.
The sun of the Dharma was perfectly full, and the light of wisdom universally illuminated, seeing without obstruction.
Born from the unborn, they gave rise to the Buddha's teachings, becoming the foremost and supreme lord of wholesome roots, giving rise to the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment.

Abiding in the power of the TathÄgata, they headed for omniscience, destroying the works of MÄra, purifying the realms of sentient beings, deeply penetrating the nature of dharmas, forever leaving behind delusion, and all their wholesome roots and great vows were not in vain.
Such bodhisattvas filled that land, and being born in such a place, having such virtues, they always performed the Buddha's work, attaining the pure light of the Buddha's enlightenment.
Endowed with the wisdom of the Dharma realm, manifesting the power of spiritual penetrations, his single body filling the entire Dharma realm;
Attaining great wisdom, entering the realm of practice of omniscience, well able to discern the meanings of the boundless Dharma realm;
In all lands, he is unattached, yet able to manifest all buddha-lands;
His mind is like space, without support, yet able to discern the entire Dharma realm, well able to enter and exit inconceivable and profound samÄdhis;
Adept in omniscience, abiding in the buddha-lands, attaining the powers of the buddhas, fearlessly expounding the innumerable dharmas;
In accord with the roots of goodness of the buddhas of the three times, universally illuminating the Dharma realm of all tathÄgatas, able to uphold all buddha-dharmas;
Knowing the dharmas of innumerable languages, well able to produce inconceivable and distinct sounds;
Entering the unsurpassed stage of a Buddha's self-mastery, they roam throughout the worlds of the ten directions without obstruction;
Practicing the Dharma of non-disputation and non-reliance, without discrimination, they cultivate and expand the mind of enlightenment;
Attaining skillful wisdom, they well understand the meaning of phrases and are able to explain and expound them in sequence.

May these great Bodhisattvas adorn their lands, filling them everywhere, abiding in accordance with them, cultivating and thoroughly cultivating them, making them pure and extremely pure, tranquil and serene.

In a single Buddha land, in each direction, there are innumerable, immeasurable, boundless, incomparable, incalculable, inconceivable, immeasurable, unspeakable, and unspeakably unspeakable great Bodhisattvas filling everywhere.
As in one direction, so it is in all directions;
Just as in one buddha-land, throughout the entire Dharma realm, all buddha-lands are also like this.
Buddha's disciple!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, with all wholesome roots, skillfully dedicate to all buddha-lands, skillfully dedicate to all bodhisattvas, skillfully dedicate to all tathÄgatas, skillfully dedicate to all buddha-enlightenment, skillfully dedicate to all vast vows, skillfully dedicate to all paths of liberation, skillfully dedicate to purifying all realms of sentient beings, skillfully dedicate to always seeing buddhas appearing in the world in all worlds, skillfully dedicate to always seeing the TathÄgata's immeasurable lifespan, skillfully dedicate to always seeing buddhas pervading the Dharma realm, turning the unobstructed, irreversible wheel of the Dharma.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dedicate all wholesome roots in this way, they universally enter all buddha-lands, and all buddha-lands are completely purified;
Because it extends to the realms of all sentient beings, all bodhisattvas are completely pure;

Buddha's disciple!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas make such dedications, they do not discriminate between self and what belongs to self, do not discriminate between buddhas and buddha-dharmas, do not discriminate between lands and their adornment and purification, do not discriminate between sentient beings and their taming, do not discriminate between karmic actions and their fruits and consequences, and are not attached to thoughts and what is produced by thoughts;

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus dedicates, he universally bestows the roots of goodness upon sentient beings, definitely maturing and equally teaching and transforming them;
Without characteristics, without conditions, without measurement, without falsehood, he is far removed from all discriminating attachments.

Namely:

Because he purifies the buddha-lands, he attains inexhaustible roots of goodness;

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus dedicates all roots of goodness, he understands that the realm of all sentient beings has no sentient beings, comprehends that all dharmas have no life, knows that all dharmas have no creator, realizes that all dharmas have no pudgala, understands that all dharmas have no disputes, observes that all dharmas arise from conditions and have no abiding place, knows that all things have no support, understands that all lands have no abiding, observes that all bodhisattva practices also have no location, and sees that all realms have no existence.

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas make such dedications, their eyes never see impure buddha-lands, nor do they see sentient beings with different characteristics. because it is perfected by immeasurable wondrous dharmas of all merits and virtues, and because it causes all sentient beings to accumulate wholesome roots and be completely satisfied everywhere.

Buddha's disciple!ğŸ”½This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva attains the ground of the ten powers beyond verbal description in every moment of thought, and is fully endowed with all merits and virtues. He accomplishes pure wholesome roots and becomes the field of merit for all sentient beings.

Wherever they go, they are able to adorn and purify all lands, and wherever they tread, they cause countless beings to all become pure, because they gather and accept blessings and virtues and cultivate all practices.

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva thus dedicates, cultivating all bodhisattva practices, his blessings and virtues are exceptionally superior, and his physical characteristics are incomparable;
His majestic power and radiance surpass all worlds, and demons and their minions cannot gaze upon him;

This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's fifth dedication, the inexhaustible merit treasury dedication.
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dwelling in this aspiration attain ten kinds of inexhaustible treasuries.
What are the ten?
Namely:
Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of seeing buddhas, because in a single pore one sees incalculable buddhas appearing in the world;
Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of entering the Dharma, because with the power of buddha-knowledge one observes all dharmas to be entirely included in a single dharma;

Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of recollection, because one upholds all the teachings spoken by the buddhas without forgetting them;ğŸ”½Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of definitive wisdom, because one skillfully knows the secret skillful means of all the teachings spoken by the buddhas;

Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of boundless realization, because with space-like knowledge one penetrates all dharmas of the three times;
Attaining the inexhaustible treasury of merit, because it is inexhaustible in fulfilling the aspirations of all sentient beings;
They attain the inexhaustible treasury of courageous and vigorous wisdom, able to eliminate all the ignorance and confusion of sentient beings;
They attain the inexhaustible treasury of definitive eloquence, expounding all the equal and impartial teachings of the Buddhas, enabling sentient beings to fully understand;

They attain the inexhaustible treasury of the ten powers and fearlessness, fully engaging in all the practices of the bodhisattvas, with the pure silk sash tied around their heads, reaching the unobstructed omniscience.

Buddha's disciples!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dedicate all their wholesome roots, they attain these ten inexhaustible treasuries.
At that time, Bodhisattva Diamond Banner surveyed the ten directions and spoke in verse, saying:

With the blessings of exhortation, request, and sympathetic joy, they skillfully dedicate them with unobstructed skillful means.
The tathÄgatas of the three times adorn and purify the buddha-lands throughout the world,
All merits are complete, and dedicating to the Pure Land is also like this.

Taking them with the mind without remainder, thus adorning the Buddha-lands.
Exhausting the kalpas of the three times, praising the merits of a Buddha-land,
The kalpas of the three times may still be exhausted, but the merits of the Buddha-land are inexhaustible.
In this way, the Bodhisattvas see all the Buddha-lands without remainder,
Collectively adorning a Buddha-land, all Buddha-lands are like this.
There are Buddha-sons with pure minds, all born from the Dharma of the Tathagata,
Their minds adorned with all merits, filling all Buddha-lands.

Eloquence is expounded throughout the world, like the boundless ocean.
Bodhisattvas abide in various samÄdhis, and all their practices are complete,

They have never recalled the vehicle of the Å›rÄvakas, nor do they seek the path of the pratyekabuddhas.

The various mÄras and enemies in the ten directions are all crushed by the bodhisattvas' power,

The bodhisattvas, with the power of these great vows, dedicate all without obstruction,
Entering the inexhaustible treasury of merit and virtue, eternally inexhaustible in the past, present, and future.
Bodhisattvas skillfully observe all conditioned phenomena, thoroughly understanding their nature to be not independent,
Having known the nature of all phenomena to be thus, they do not mistakenly grasp karma and its fruits.
There are no form dharmas and no formless dharmas, also no thoughts and no absence of thoughts,
Existing dharmas and non-existing dharmas are all non-existent, thoroughly understanding that all are unobtainable.
All dharmas arise from causes and conditions, their essential nature is neither existent nor non-existent,
Yet within causes and conditions and what arises from them, they are ultimately without attachment.
In the realm of the languages of all sentient beings, there is ultimately nothing to be obtained,
Thoroughly understanding that names and characteristics are all conceptual distinctions, clearly understanding that all dharmas are devoid of self.
Just as the nature of sentient beings is originally quiescent and extinguished, so it is to thoroughly understand all dharmas,
The three times encompass all without exception, and the lands and all karmic actions are equal.
Using such wisdom to turn toward enlightenment, in accordance with one's understanding, meritorious actions arise.
The characteristics of these merits are also like understanding, how could there be anything to be attained within them?
Thus, the mind of turning toward enlightenment is without defilements, and never measures the nature of dharmas.
Understanding that their nature is all non-nature, one does not abide in the world nor does one leave it.
All the good actions that are practiced are all turned toward all beings,
Without not penetrating to their true nature, all discriminations are eliminated.
All false views are all abandoned without remainder,
Free from all vexations, always cool and refreshing, dwelling in the unhindered stage of liberation.
The bodhisattva does not destroy all dharmas, nor does he destroy the nature of dharmas,
Understanding all dharmas to be like echoes, without attachment to anything.
Knowing that sentient beings of the three times all arise from the combination of causes and conditions,
Also knowing the mental inclinations and habitual tendencies, never destroying any dharmas.
Realizing that the nature of karma is not karma, yet also not contradicting the characteristics of dharmas,
Also not destroying the fruits of karma, teaching that the nature of dharmas arises from conditions.
Knowing that sentient beings have no birth, also that there are no sentient beings who transmigrate,
No real sentient beings to be spoken of, only provisionally proclaimed based on worldly convention.
Buddha's disciple!
What is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's steadfast and firm dedication to all wholesome roots?

This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva may be a king ruling a great country, with vast authority and fame resounding throughout the world. They fully practice all kinds of giving, either giving food and drink and various delicacies, or giving vehicles, or giving clothing, or giving flower garlands, various fragrances, ointments, beds, seats, dwellings, excellent lamps, medicine for illness, jeweled vessels, jeweled carriages, well-bred elephants and horses, all of which they joyfully give with adornments.

If someone comes to beg for the seat occupied by the king, or for a canopy, or for a flag, or for jeweled adornments, or for the jeweled crown on the head, or for the luminous pearl in the topknot, or even for the king's position, they are not stingy at all.
If they see sentient beings in prison, they give up all their wealth, wives, children, and relatives, and even their own bodies to rescue them and set them free.
If they see prisoners about to be executed, they immediately give up their own bodies to replace the lives of those to be executed.
If they see someone come to beg for their hair with skin, they joyfully give it without being stingy.

eyes, ears, nose, tongue, teeth, head, hands, feet, blood, flesh, bones, marrow, heart, kidneys, liver, lungs, large intestine, small intestine, thick skin, thin skin, fingers and toes, flesh, nails, with a joyful mind, giving all of these.

in order to uphold the TathÄgata's true teachings, they would endure all kinds of suffering and hardship with their bodies;
in order to seek the Dharma, even a single word, they would be willing to give up everything within the four seas.

Or they give land to build monasteries, halls, and residences;

For the sake of sentient beings, they serve and make offerings.
They may give up their royal positions, cities, villages, palaces, gardens, wives, and relatives, fulfilling all their wishes according to their requests.
Or they may give up all their possessions and universally set up great giving assemblies without obstruction;

In those assemblies, sentient beings with various fields of blessings, some coming from far away and some from near, some wise and some foolish, some good-looking and some ugly, men and women, humans and non-humans, with different mental dispositions and various desires, they give equally to all and satisfy them completely.
Buddha's disciple!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is thus giving, he arouses a mind of good embrace and dedicates it all.
Namely:
Good embrace of form, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots;
Good embrace of perception, conception, volition, and consciousness, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots;
Good embrace of the royal position, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots;ğŸ”½Good embrace of relatives, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots;
Good embrace of resources, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots;
Good embrace of generosity, in accordance with and firmly establishing all wholesome roots.
Buddha's disciple!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, according to the immeasurable and boundless objects of giving, dedicates those wholesome roots in this way, namely:
When giving delicious food to sentient beings, the mind is pure, without greed, attachment, or stinginess towards the objects of giving, and fully practices giving;
May all sentient beings attain the food of wisdom, their minds unobstructed, understanding the nature of food, not attached to anything, but delighting in the food of Dharma joy and liberation;
May their wisdom be filled, may they abide firmly in the Dharma, gather wholesome roots, and their Dharma body and wisdom body be pure and unimpeded;
May they compassionately benefit sentient beings, become their field of blessings, and manifest acceptance of solid food.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving food.
Buddha's disciple!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives drinks, he dedicates the wholesome roots in this way:
'May all sentient beings drink the water of the Dharma flavor, diligently cultivate and practice, and perfect the bodhisattva path;
May they cut off worldly craving and always seek the Buddha's wisdom;
May they leave behind sensual objects and attain the joy of Dharma delight;
May they be born from the pure Dharma and always regulate their minds with samÄdhi;
Entering the ocean of wisdom, raising great Dharma clouds, and showering the great Dharma rain.
' This is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness when giving drinks.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give various pure and excellent flavors.
Namely:
Spicy, sour, salty, bland, and sweet and bitter.
Various flavors are fully moistening, able to make the four elements peaceful and harmonious, the body full, and the strength strong, the mind always pure and joyful;
When swallowing and chewing, there is no coughing or choking;
The faculties are clear and sharp, the inner organs are full;
Poisons cannot invade, diseases cannot harm;
From beginning to end, there are no worries, and one forever attains peace and happiness.
With these roots of goodness, one thus dedicates them, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain the supreme flavor, filled with nectar;
May all sentient beings attain the flavor of the wisdom of the Dharma and understand the functions of all flavors;
May all sentient beings attain immeasurable flavors of the Dharma and thoroughly understand the Dharma realm, peacefully abiding in the great Dharma city of ultimate reality;
May all sentient beings become great Dharma clouds, pervading the Dharma realm and showering the rain of Dharma, teaching and transforming all sentient beings;
May all sentient beings attain the flavor of supreme wisdom, with unsurpassed Dharma joy filling their bodies and minds;
May all sentient beings attain the flavor of non-attachment to all superior flavors, unstained by worldly flavors, always diligently cultivating all Buddha-Dharmas;
May all sentient beings attain the flavor of the single Dharma, understanding that all Buddha-Dharmas are ultimately without distinction;
May all sentient beings attain the flavor of supremacy, riding the wisdom of omniscience without ever regressing;
May all sentient beings attain entry into the flavor of the non-differentiated Dharma of the Buddhas, able to discern all faculties;
May all sentient beings increase their enjoyment of the Dharma and always attain the fulfillment of unobstructed Buddha-Dharma.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving flavors,
in order to enable all sentient beings to diligently cultivate merit and virtue and be fully endowed with the body of unobstructed wisdom.'
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give vehicles, they dedicate the wholesome roots in the following way: namely,

'May all sentient beings attain the complete wisdom vehicle, ride the great vehicle, the indestructible vehicle, the supreme vehicle, the unsurpassed vehicle, the swift vehicle, the powerful vehicle, the vehicle fully endowed with merit, the supramundane vehicle, and the vehicle that gives rise to innumerable bodhisattvas.
' This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving vehicles.
Buddha's disciple!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give clothing, they dedicate the wholesome roots in the following way: namely,

'May all sentient beings obtain the robe of shame and modesty to cover their bodies, abandon the evil practices of naked ascetics, have a lustrous complexion, delicate skin, accomplish the supreme bliss of the Buddhas, and attain the purest omniscience.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of merit when giving away clothing.
